  16. (* File comparison tools *)

  18. open Ocamltest_stdlib

  20. ‌type result =
  21.   | Same
  22.   | Different
  23.   | Unexpected_output
  24.   | Error of string * int

  26. ‌type ignore = {bytes: int; lines: int}
  27. ‌type tool =
  28.   |  External of {
  29.                    tool_name : string;
  30.                    tool_flags : string;
  31.                    result_of_exitcode : string -> int -> result
  32.                 }
  33.   | Internal of ignore

  35. ‌let cmp_result_of_exitcode commandline = function
  36.   | 0 -> Same
  37.   | 1 -> Different
  38.   | exit_code -> (Error (commandline, exit_code))

  40. ‌let make_cmp_tool ~ignore =
  41.   Internal ignore

  43. ‌let make_comparison_tool ?(result_of_exitcode = cmp_result_of_exitcode)
  44.                          name flags =
  45.   External
  46.     {
  47.       tool_name = name;
  48.       tool_flags = flags;
  49.       result_of_exitcode
  50.     }

  52. ‌let default_comparison_tool = make_cmp_tool ~ignore:{bytes=0;lines=0}

  54. ‌type filetype = Binary | Text

  56. ‌type files = {
  57.   filetype : filetype;
  58.   reference_filename : string;
  59.   output_filename : string;
  60. }

  62. ‌let last_is_cr s =
  63.   let l = String.length s in
  64.   l > 0 && s.[l - 1] = '\r'

  66. (* Returns last character of an input file. Fails for an empty file. *)
  67. ‌let last_char ic =
  68.   seek_in ic (in_channel_length ic - 1);
  69.   input_char ic

  71. (* [line_seq_of_in_channel ~normalise ic first_line] constructs a sequence of
  72.    the lines of [ic] where [first_line] is the already read first line of [ic].
  73.    Strings include the line terminator and CRLF is normalised to LF if
  74.    [normalise] is [true]. The sequence raises [Exit] if normalise is [true] and
  75.    a terminated line is encountered which does not end CRLF. The final line of
  76.    the sequence only includes a terminator if it is present in the file (and a
  77.    terminating CR is never normalised if not strictly followed by LF). *)
  78. ‌let line_seq_of_in_channel ~normalise ic =
  79.   let normalise =
  80.     if normalise then
  81.       fun s ->
  82.         if last_is_cr s then
  83.           String.sub s 0 (String.length s - 1)
  84.         else
  85.           raise Exit
  86.     else
  87.       Fun.id
  88.   in
  89. ‌    let rec read_line last () =
  90.       (* Read the next line to determine if the last line ended with LF *)
  91.       match input_line ic with
  92.       | line ->
  93.           Seq.Cons (normalise last ^ "\n", read_line line)
  94.       | exception End_of_file ->
  95.           (* EOF reached - seek the last character to determine if the final
  96.              line ends in LF *)
  97.           let last =
  98.             if last_char ic = '\n' then
  99.               normalise last ^ "\n"
  100.             else
  101.               last
  102.           in
  103.             Seq.Cons (last, Seq.empty)
  104.     in
  105.       read_line

  107. ‌let compare_text_files ignored_lines file1 file2 =
  108.   Sys.with_input_file ~bin:true file2 @@ fun ic2 ->
  109.     (* Get the first non-dropped line of file2 and determine if could be
  110.        CRLF-normalised (it can't be in any of the dropped lines didn't end
  111.        CRLF. *)
  112.     let (crlf_endings2, line2, reached_end_file2) =
  113.       let rec loop crlf_endings2 k =
  114.         match input_line ic2 with
  115.         | line ->
  116.             let crlf_endings2 = crlf_endings2 && last_is_cr line in
  117.             if k = 0 then
  118.               (crlf_endings2, line, false)
  119.             else
  120.               loop crlf_endings2 (pred k)
  121.         | exception End_of_file ->
  122.             (false, "", true)
  123.       in
  124.         loop true ignored_lines
  125.     in
  126.       Sys.with_input_file ~bin:true file1 @@ fun ic1 ->
  127.         if reached_end_file2 then
  128.           (* We reached the end of file2 while ignoring lines, so only an empty
  129.              file can be identical, as in the binary comparison case. *)
  130.           if in_channel_length ic1 = 0 then
  131.             Same
  132.           else
  133.             Different
  134.         else
  135.           (* file2 has at least one non-ignored line *)
  136.           match input_line ic1 with
  137.           | exception End_of_file -> Different
  138.           | line1 ->
  139. ‌              let crlf_endings1 = last_is_cr line1 in
  140.               (* If both files appear to have CRLF endings, then there's no need
  141.                  to attempt to normalise either. *)
  142. ‌              let seq1 =
  143.                 let normalise = crlf_endings1 && not crlf_endings2 in
  144.                 line_seq_of_in_channel ~normalise ic1 line1 in
  145. ‌              let seq2 =
  146.                 let normalise = crlf_endings2 && not crlf_endings1 in
  147.                 line_seq_of_in_channel ~normalise ic2 line2 in
  148.               try
  149.                 if Seq.equal seq1 seq2 then
  150.                   Same
  151.                 else
  152.                   raise Exit
  153.               with Exit ->
  154.                 (* Either the lines weren't equal, or the file which was being
  155.                    normalised suddenly had a line which didn't end CRLF. In this
  156.                    case, the files must differ since only one file is ever being
  157.                    normalised, so the earlier lines differed too. *)
  158.                 Different

  160. (* Version of Stdlib.really_input which stops at EOF, rather than raising
  161.    an exception. *)
  162. ‌let really_input_up_to ic =
  163.   let block_size = 8192 in
  164.   let buf = Bytes.create block_size in
  165.   let rec read pos =
  166.     let bytes_read = input ic buf pos (block_size - pos) in
  167.     let new_pos = pos + bytes_read in
  168.     if bytes_read = 0 || new_pos = block_size then
  169.       new_pos
  170.     else
  171.       read new_pos
  172.   in
  173. ‌  let bytes_read = read 0 in
  174.   if bytes_read = block_size then
  175.     buf
  176.   else
  177.     Bytes.sub buf 0 bytes_read

  179. ‌let compare_binary_files bytes_to_ignore file1 file2 =
  180.   Sys.with_input_file ~bin:true file1 @@ fun ic1 ->
  181.   Sys.with_input_file ~bin:true file2 @@ fun ic2 ->
  182.   seek_in ic1 bytes_to_ignore;
  183.   seek_in ic2 bytes_to_ignore;
  184.   let rec compare () =
  185.     let block1 = really_input_up_to ic1 in
  186.     let block2 = really_input_up_to ic2 in
  187.     if block1 = block2 then
  188.       if Bytes.length block1 > 0 then
  189.         compare ()
  190.       else
  191.         Same
  192.     else
  193.       Different
  194.   in
  195.   compare ()

  197. ‌let compare_files ?(tool = default_comparison_tool) files =
  198.   match tool with
  199.   | External {tool_name; tool_flags; result_of_exitcode} ->
  200.       let commandline = String.concat " "
  201.       [
  202.         tool_name;
  203.         tool_flags;
  204.         files.reference_filename;
  205.         files.output_filename
  206.       ] in
  207.       let settings = Run_command.settings_of_commandline
  208.         ~stdout_fname:Filename.null ~stderr_fname:Filename.null commandline in
  209.       let status = Run_command.run settings in
  210.       result_of_exitcode commandline status
  211.   | Internal ignore ->
  212.       match files.filetype with
  213.         | Text ->
  214.             (* bytes_to_ignore is silently ignored for text files *)
  215.             compare_text_files ignore.lines
  216.               files.reference_filename files.output_filename
  217.         | Binary ->
  218.             compare_binary_files ignore.bytes
  219.                                  files.reference_filename files.output_filename

  221. ‌let check_file ?(tool = default_comparison_tool) files =
  222.   if Sys.file_exists files.reference_filename
  223.   then compare_files ~tool:tool files
  224.   else begin
  225.     if Sys.file_is_empty files.output_filename
  226.     then Same
  227.     else Unexpected_output
  228.   end

  230. ‌let diff files =
  231.   let temporary_file = Filename.temp_file "ocamltest" "diff" in
  232.   let diff = Ocamltest_config.diff in
  233.   let diff_flags = String.words Ocamltest_config.diff_flags in
  234.   let diff_files = [files.reference_filename; files.output_filename] in
  235.   let diff_commandline =
  236.     Filename.quote_command diff ~stdout:temporary_file
  237.       (diff_flags @ diff_files)
  238.   in
  239.   let result =
  240.     match Sys.command diff_commandline with
  241.     | 0 -> Ok "Inconsistent LF/CRLF line-endings"
  242.     | 2 -> Stdlib.Error "diff"
  243.     | _ -> Ok (Sys.string_of_file temporary_file)
  244.   in
  245.   Sys.force_remove temporary_file;
  246.   result

  248. ‌let promote {filetype; reference_filename; output_filename} ignore_conf =
  249.   match filetype, ignore_conf with
  250.   | Text, {lines = skip_lines; _} ->
  251.       Sys.with_output_file reference_filename @@ fun reference ->
  252.       Sys.with_input_file output_filename @@ fun output ->
  253.       for _ = 1 to skip_lines do
  254.         try ignore (input_line output) with End_of_file -> ()
  255.       done;
  256.       Sys.copy_chan output reference
  257.   | Binary, {bytes = skip_bytes; _} ->
  258.       Sys.with_output_file ~bin:true reference_filename @@ fun reference ->
  259.       Sys.with_input_file ~bin:true output_filename @@ fun output ->
  260.       seek_in output skip_bytes;
  261.       Sys.copy_chan output reference
